definition: to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent

sentences.english: The small boat could not stem the rushing tide.
sentences.chinese: 這艘小船頂不住洶湧奔騰的潮水。

sentences.english: A wave of grief engulfed them.
sentences.chinese: 洶湧的大海吞沒了那艘小機帆船。

sentences.english: Clouds and showers soon returned to Sochi, and the Black Sea returned to its seasonally typical tempestuous ways.
sentences.chinese: 雲和雨回到索契，黑海恢復季節性的洶湧。

sentences.english: We watched the heavy outflow of the tide.
sentences.chinese: 我們觀看了洶湧奔出的潮水。

sentences.english: Along with the economic globalization, the times of knowledge-based economy is coming.
sentences.chinese: 隨着經濟全球化浪潮的洶湧，知識經濟時代早已到來。

sentences.english: East China Sea mighty waves surges forward, the wave of our reform rushes ahead.
sentences.chinese: 東海波濤洶湧澎湃，改革大浪一往直前。

sentences.english: The fans surged forward to the the movie star.
sentences.chinese: 影迷們洶湧地奔去看那個影星。

sentences.english: The Bay of Biscay can be very rough at times.
sentences.chinese: 大西洋的比斯開灣有時也會巨浪洶湧。

sentences.english: A surge of demonstrators broke through the fence.
He bade them to allow not her waters to escape.
sentences.chinese: 他命令她們駐守，以防她體內的水流洶湧而出。

sentences.english: Kamino is a planet of tumultuous oceans and endless storms.
sentences.chinese: 卡米諾是一顆被洶湧海洋和無盡風暴覆蓋的行星。

sentences.english: The ship is bucketing through the rough sea.
sentences.chinese: 船在巨浪洶湧的海面上飛速行駛着。

sentences.english: The weather is now stormy and brooding, and the placid waters of the fountain have become choppy and angry.
sentences.chinese: 原本平靜的噴泉水變得洶湧起來。

sentences.english: But we continue to steer a steady course through choppy waters, " he added.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們繼續穩定地通過波濤洶湧的水域”他補充道。

sentences.english: The rough waves capsized the rowboat .
sentences.chinese: 洶湧的波濤掀翻了划艇。

sentences.english: See the net that is like flourishing swim business also undercurrent is billowy .
sentences.chinese: 看似紅火的網遊業務也暗潮洶湧。

definition: lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
(of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
lit. breeze is still, waves are quiet (idiom); tranquil environment/all is quiet/a dead calm (at sea)
